company.name: DesignerWare, LLC
company.business_description: DesignerWare develops and licenses software called PC Rental Agent to rent-to-own stores. The software is installed on rented computers and enables rent-to-own store licensees to remotely disable computers when consumers are late on payments, track computer location, and monitor user activities through a feature called Detective Mode.

case_info.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C § 45 et seq.

complaint.factual_background: DesignerWare developed PC Rental Agent software that it licensed to rent-to-own stores for installation on rented computers. The software enabled stores to remotely activate Detective Mode to secretly monitor computer users through webcams, keystroke logging, and screenshots, capturing highly sensitive personal information including medical records, financial data, and intimate photographs. DesignerWare also tracked users' physical locations through WiFi hotspot monitoring without notice or consent. The company provided rent-to-own stores with fake software registration windows to deceptively gather consumers' contact information.

representations_made.description: Represented through fake pop-up notices that they were legitimate software registration forms from trusted providers (Microsoft Windows, Internet Explorer, Microsoft Office, Yahoo! Messenger) that must be filled out to continue using the software
representations_made.quoted_text: represented to consumers, expressly or by implication, that certain pop-up notices that appear on a computer’s screen are notices from trusted software providers that contain software registration forms that must be filled out with the consumers’ contact information in order to continue to use the providers’ software.

counts.title: Unfair Gathering and Disclosure of Consumers' Personal Information
counts.representation: DesignerWare installed monitoring software on rented computers, gathered sensitive personal, financial, and medical information about consumers, disclosed that information to rent-to-own stores, and installed geophysical location tracking software without consent, tracking locations without notice and disclosing location information to licensees
counts.fact: These actions cause or are likely to cause substantial injury to consumers that cannot be reasonably avoided and is not outweighed by countervailing benefits to consumers or competition
counts.conclusion: Therefore, respondents' practices constitute unfair acts or practices in violation of Section 5 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Means and Instrumentalities to Engage in Unfairness
counts.representation: DesignerWare furnished rent-to-own stores with software that records keystrokes, captures screenshots, activates webcams, tracks geophysical location without consent or notice, and provided stores with improperly gathered consumer information for debt collection purposes
counts.fact: By furnishing others with the means to engage in these unfair practices, respondents caused or are likely to cause substantial injury to consumers that cannot be reasonably avoided and is not outweighed by countervailing benefits to consumers or competition
counts.conclusion: Therefore, respondents' practices constitute unfair acts or practices in violation of Section 5 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Deceptive Gathering and Disclosure of Consumers' Personal Information
counts.representation: Respondents represented that pop-up notices appearing on computers' screens were notices from trusted software providers containing software registration forms that must be filled out with consumers' contact information to continue using the providers' software
counts.fact: In truth and in fact, these pop-up notices were not from trusted software providers and did not contain software registration forms that must be filled out to continue using software, but instead served only to cause consumers to provide contact information to be provided to respondents' rent-to-own store licensees
counts.conclusion: Therefore, respondents' practices constitute deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

definitions.respondent: DesignerWare and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: Commerce shall be defined as it is defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.
definitions.Computer: any desktop or laptop computer, handheld device, tablet, telephone, or other electronic product or device that has a platform on which to download, install, or run any software program, code, script, or other content.
definitions.Geophysical location tracking technology: any hardware, software, or application utilized in conjunction with a computer that collects and reports data or information that identifies the precise geophysical location of the computer. Geophysical location tracking technologies include, for these purposes, technologies that report: the GPS coordinates of a computer; the WiFi signals available to or actually used by a computer to access the Internet; the telecommunication towers or connections available to or actually used by a computer; the processing of any such reported data through geolocation lookup services; or any information derived from any combination of the foregoing.
definitions.Monitoring technology:
any hardware, software, or application utilized in conjunction with a computer that can cause the computer to (1) capture, monitor, or record, and (2) report information about user activities by:

a. Recording keystrokes, clicks, or other user-generated actions;

b. Capturing screenshots of the information displayed on a computer monitor or screen; or

c. Activating the camera or microphone function of a computer to take photographs or record audio or visual content through the computer's webcam or microphone.
definitions.Covered rent-to-own transaction: any transaction where a consumer enters into an agreement for the purchase or rental of a computer and the consumer's contract or rental agreement provides for payments over time and an option to purchase the computer.

provisions.title: Monitoring Technology Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from using monitoring technology to gather information from computers rented to consumers and from providing such technology to third parties.

requirements.description: Must not use monitoring technology to gather information or data from any computer rented to a consumer
requirements.quoted_text: A. Using any monitoring technology to gather information or data from any computer rented to a consumer; and

requirements.description: Must not license, sell, or otherwise provide third parties with monitoring technology for installation or activation on computers rented to consumers
requirements.quoted_text: B. Licensing, selling, or otherwise providing third parties with monitoring technology for installation or activation on computers rented to consumers.

provisions.title: Use of Tracking Technology Limited
provisions.summary: Respondent may only use geophysical location tracking technology if clear and prominent notice is provided to users and affirmative express consent is obtained from renters, with specific exceptions for stolen computers.

requirements.description: Must provide clear and prominent notice at the time the computer is rented and immediately prior to each use of geophysical location tracking technology, and obtain affirmative express consent at the time the computer is rented
requirements.quoted_text: A. Gathering any information or data from any computer via any geophysical location tracking technology without ensuring that the computer user is provided clear and prominent notice at the time the computer is rented and immediately prior to each use of the geophysical location tracking technology, and also ensuring that the computer renter’s affirmative express consent is obtained at the time the computer is rented. For purposes of this section, providing clear and prominent notice to computer users and obtaining affirmative express consent from computer renters means:

requirements.description: Clear and prominent notice must be provided separate from privacy policies or agreements, disclosing that tracking is installed/running, types of activity captured, entities with whom data will be shared, purpose of collection, and contact information
requirements.quoted_text: 1. Clear and Prominent Notice: a clear and prominent notice is provided to the user, separate and apart from any “privacy policy,” “data use policy,” “terms of service,” “end-user license agreement,” “lease agreement,” or other similar document, that discloses (1) that geophysical location tracking technology is installed and/or currently running on the computer; (2) the types of user activity or conduct that is being captured by such technology; (3) the identities or specific categories of entities with whom any data or information that is collected will be shared or otherwise provided; (4) the purpose(s) for the collection, use, or sharing of such data or information; and (5) where and how the user can contact someone for additional information;

requirements.description: Affirmative express consent must be obtained by giving the renter an equally clear and prominent choice to agree or not agree, with neither option highlighted or preselected, and activation must not proceed until consent is provided
requirements.quoted_text: 2. Affirmative Express Consent: affirmative express consent is obtained by giving the computer renter an equally clear and prominent choice to either agree or not agree to any geophysical location tracking technology, and neither option may be highlighted or preselected as a default setting. Activation of any geophysical location tracking technology must not proceed until the computer’s renter provides affirmative express consent. Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing in this Part shall require that a computer be rented to a user who declines to consent to installation or activation of any geophysical tracking technology;

requirements.description: Must install a clear and prominent icon on the computer where tracking is activated, such as on the desktop and system tray, that when clicked discloses tracking status, activity captured, data sharing, purpose, and contact information
requirements.quoted_text: 3. Icons: the activation of any geophysical location tracking technology shall be accompanied by the installation of a clear and prominent icon on the computer on which the technology is installed, such as on the desktop and in the desktop system tray of the computer. Clicking on the icon must clearly and prominently disclose: (1) that geophysical location tracking technology is installed and currently running on the Page 4 of 8 computer; (2) the types of user activity or conduct that is being captured by such technology; (3) the identities or specific categories of entities with whom any data or information that is collected will be shared or otherwise provided; (4) the purpose(s) for the collection, use, or sharing of such data or information; and (5) where and how the user can contact someone for additional information;

requirements.description: Must retain documents establishing that the computer was reported stolen and a police report was filed when notice requirements are suspended for stolen computer tracking
requirements.quoted_text: Provided that the notice requirements of this Part may be suspended and geophysical location tracking technology activated if (a) the renter reports that the computer has been stolen or there is otherwise a reasonable basis to believe that the computer has been stolen, and (b) either the renter or another person has filed a police report stating that the computer has been stolen. Provided further that respondent shall ensure that documents establishing (a) and (b) are retained. For purposes of this Order, “filing of a police report” means the reporting of a complaint with the police department in any form recognized in the jurisdiction;

requirements.description: When acting as licensor, must include contractual requirements in licensing agreements that licensees may only activate tracking for stolen computers with police reports and must retain supporting documents
requirements.quoted_text: Provided further that the notice and record-keeping requirements of this Section II shall be satisfied when respondent acts as a licensor if respondent includes in the licensing agreement contractual requirements that: (i) licensees may only activate geophysical location tracking technology if (a) the renter reports that the computer has been stolen or there is otherwise a reasonable basis to believe that the computer has been stolen and (b) either the renter or another person has filed a police report stating that the computer has been stolen, and (ii) documents establishing (a) and (b) are retained by the licensees; and

requirements.description: Must not license, sell, or provide geophysical location tracking technology to third parties without requiring as a condition that the third party obtain consent and provide notice as specified
requirements.quoted_text: B. Licensing, selling, or otherwise providing any third party with geophysical location tracking technology for installation or activation on a computer to be rented in a covered rent-to-own transaction, without requiring as a condition of the license, sale, or other provision of the technology that the third party obtain consent and provide notice as provided in Section II.A, above.

provisions.title: No Deceptive Gathering of Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from making false representations or deceptions in any notice, prompt, or software application that results in gathering information from or about consumers.

requirements.description: Must not make or assist others to make any false representation or depiction in any notice, prompt screen, or other software application appearing on the screen of any computer that results in gathering information from or about a consumer
requirements.quoted_text: permanently restrained and enjoined from making, or assisting others to make, any false representation or depiction in any notice, prompt screen, or other software application appearing on the screen of any computer that results in gathering information from or about a consumer, including without limitation location information.

provisions.title: Protection of Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete previously gathered non-compliant data and ensure that data transmitted from tracking technology is encrypted during transmission.

requirements.description: Must delete or destroy all user data previously gathered using any monitoring or geophysical location tracking technology that does not comply with Parts I, II, and III of this Order, unless prohibited by court order or legal obligation
requirements.quoted_text: A. Delete or destroy all user data, if any, previously gathered using any monitoring or geophysical location tracking technology that does not comply with Parts I, II, and III of this Order, unless such action is otherwise prohibited by court order or other legal obligation; and

requirements.description: Must transfer data gathered by monitoring or geophysical location tracking technology only if such information is rendered unreadable, unusable, or indecipherable during transmission
requirements.quoted_text: B. Transfer data or information, if any, gathered by any monitoring or geophysical location tracking technology from the computer upon which the technology is installed to respondent’s server(s), and from the respondent’s server(s) to any other computers or servers only if such information is rendered unreadable, unusable, or indecipherable during transmission.

provisions.title: No Misrepresentations About Privacy
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects the security, privacy, or confidentiality of personal information gathered from or about consumers.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent, in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent maintains and protects the security, privacy, or confidentiality of any personal information gathered from or about consumers
requirements.quoted_text: indirectly, shall not misrepresent, in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent maintains and protects the security, privacy, or confidentiality of any personal information gathered from or about consumers.

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities related to the subject matter of this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers who have responsibilities related to the subject matter of this order, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent

requirements.description: Must deliver this order to current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order
requirements.quoted_text: shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position

requirements.description: Must deliver this order to future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities. From each person to whom respondent delivers a copy of this order,

requirements.description: Must obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this order from each person to whom respondent delivers a copy, with electronic signatures complying with the E-Sign Act
requirements.quoted_text: or responsibilities. From each person to whom respondent delivers a copy of this order, respondent must obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this order, with any electronic signatures complying with the requirements of the E-Sign Act, 15 U.S.C. § 7001 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file compliance reports with the Commission and notify the Commission of any corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations.

requirements.description: Must file with the Commission a true and accurate written report setting forth in detail the manner and form in which they have complied with this order within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, and at such other times as the Commission may require
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, and its successors and assigns, shall within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, and at such other times as the Commission may require, file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form in

requirements.description: Must submit additional true and accurate written reports within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: which they have complied with this order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, they shall submit additional true and accurate written reports.

requirements.description: Must notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, subsidiary creation/dissolution, bankruptcy filing, or name/address change
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent, and its successors and assigns, shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to, dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or related entity that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address. Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation about

requirements.description: If respondent learns of a proposed corporate change less than thirty (30) days prior to the action, must notify the Commission as soon as practicable after obtaining such knowledge
requirements.quoted_text: address. Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation about which respondent learns less than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, the respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

requirements.description: All notices required by this Part must be sent by overnight courier to the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, or by first class mail with contemporaneous electronic version sent to DEbrief@ftc.gov
requirements.quoted_text: C. Unless otherwise directed by a representative of the Commission, all notices required by this Part shall be sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20580, with the subject line DesignerWare, LLC, File No. 1123151. Provided, however; that, in lieu of overnight courier, notices may be sent by first class mail, but only if an electronic version of each such notice is contemporaneously sent to the Commission at DEbrief@ftc.gov.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years documents relating to complaints, compliance, and acknowledgments of this order.

requirements.description: Must maintain and upon reasonable notice make available to the FTC for inspection and copying, for five (5) years after the last date of any act or practice covered by Parts I-V, documents comprising or relating to complaints or inquiries concerning monitoring or geophysical tracking technologies and responses to those complaints or inquiries
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall, for five (5) years after the last date of any act or practice covered by Parts I – V of this Order, maintain and upon reasonable notice make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that: A. Comprise or relate to complaints or inquiries, whether received directly, indirectly, or through any third party, concerning any monitoring or geophysical tracking technologies sold, licensed, or otherwise provided to any third party for use in connection with any covered rent-to-own transaction, and any responses to those complaints or inquiries;

requirements.description: Must maintain documents reasonably necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this order, including all reports submitted to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: B. Are reasonably necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this order, including but not limited to, all documents obtained, created, generated, or which in any way relate to the requirements, provisions, or terms of this order, and all reports submitted to the Commission pursuant to this order;

requirements.description: Must maintain documents that contradict, qualify, or call into question respondent's compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: C. Contradict, qualify, or call into question respondent’s compliance with this order; or

requirements.description: Must maintain documents acknowledging receipt of this order obtained pursuant to Part VI
requirements.quoted_text: D. Acknowledge receipt of this order obtained pursuant to Part VI.

provisions.title: Termination of Order
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order terminates on April 11, 2033, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date the United States or FTC files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later
requirements.quoted_text: This Order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Federal Trade Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of:

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Federal Trade Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. Any Part in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. This Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Part as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.
